name: DOG WOLVE
description:
Imagine you're walking out of a 7/11 sporting a hefty Big Gulp®; You see a crumpled up piece of paper in the parking lot. Curious, you walk over and pick it up. It reads:

"This is a formal invitation for you to visit 'The Magic Parking Lot', 4 AM this Sunday."

The words: "Going to a strange parking lot at 4 AM can't be anything but a good idea." Flash across your mind.

DOG WOLVE is a first-person, TV smash 'em up, music-video, game. It features:

  • The wonderful music of Dragonette remixed by Midnight Juggernauts.
  • An incredible, unlit, art style.
  • A cute doggy friend.
  • Playtime: Six minutes, length of the song.
  • Controls: WASD to move | Click to hit | ESC to quit
  • Platforms: Windows, OSX, and Linux. Desktop compiled.
  • System Requirements: DX9 compatible GPU. You could run this game on a toaster.
  • Price: Totally free because of copywritten music.

Press:

Offworld - "...it all just comes together with the song in a way you kind of have to try for yourself."

Rock Paper Shotgun - "Slam a tape into your boom box, draw your baseball bat, and for six minutes go break some trash televisions with your dog."

Made by Ryan Trawick (ryantrawick.com/)

WARNING: Loud Music, Epileptic Text, Meaningless Scores, and Ugly TVs.
